items.content_html:
Description

Fix both the example and description of the :fullscreen pseudo class page.

Motivation

Problems:

  • The example doesn't work without Javascript but the script is not provided.
  • The description of :fullscreen pseudo class is wrong. The pseudo class does not activate when the browser or document is in fullscreen mode at all. It matches element that is fullscreen.

Fixes:

  • Add javascript and a parent element for the Fullscreen API to work with. Parent element is not required but it better demonstrates the nature of the whole API set.
  • Correct the descriptions.
  • Use color name instead of rgb to improve readability of the example.

Additional details

From the specification of :fullscreen, 5.1:

The :fullscreen pseudo-class must match any [element](https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-element) for which one of the following conditions is true:

  • element’s fullscreen flag is set.

  • element is a shadow host and the result of retargeting its node document’s fullscreen element against element is element.

A JSFiddle example showing the working example: https://jsfiddle.net/yookoala/veu1n3rt/

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #29950
items.title: Fix :fullscreen documentation

items.content_html:
Description

This PR aims to improve the <source> element documentation by making the following updates:

  • Refines the introductory paragraph in the "Attributes" section by adding the lead-in sentence, "In addition, the following attributes can be used with it." (This addition could potentially be added to the HTML reference page template.)
  • Aligns attribute descriptions by first explaining "what it is", followed by whether or not it is allowed.
  • Replaces the numbered list in srcset with a bulleted list.
  • Moves the last two paragraphs in the "Attributes" section to the "Usage notes" section for better placement.
  • Updates example headings to adopt a gerund form and to eliminate the redundant use of "example".
  • Updates link texts to guides to match the titles of those pages.
  • Replaces "user agent" with "browser" for consistency.

Motivation

To improve the readability and consistency

Additional details

Doc issue tracker: #29788
items.title: docs(fix): Improve `<source>` element page for consistency and clarity

items.content_html:
Description

Firefox 120 adds back support for media attribute in the <source> element when the parent of the <source> element is <audio> or <video>.

Additional details

The evolution of addition and removal of support for media attribute in Firefox is described in this comment.

Related issues and pull requests

Doc issue tracker: #29788
Bugzilla bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1836128
items.title: docs(relnote): Fx120 - Support for `media` in `<source>`

items.content_html:
Description

This PR is for the editorial review of #29049, which was kindly tech-reviewed by @josepharhar.

Description

This PR adds content for multiple related features that go together to enable the creation of exit/entrance animations using simple CSS, or to put it another way, animating to/from display: none (this includes top layer elements like popovers), or animating elements when they have just been added to the DOM.

Specifically, these are:

  • @starting-style: Chrome 117
  • The overlay property: Chrome 117
  • Animating to/from display: none and content-visibility: hidden: Chrome 116
  • The transition-behavior property: Chrome 117

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: feat: Editorial review: Add content for overlay and discrete animation features

items.content_html:
This is an optimisation of the code to get a user model for creating a user, and also for adding an association between a borrowed bookinstance and a User.

I say optimisation because the current code works. However, as noted in mdn/django-locallibrary-tutorial#127, in some places Django appears to recommend that you create a custom user and reference that instead (in others it just says "there are cases you will need to do this".

This is a compromise. It shows how to reference a custom user model, but since we don't need one for this project, it defaults to the original. I think this is better because it is no more work for a user, and makes later adding a custom user model a lot easier.

Associated code is mdn/django-locallibrary-tutorial#127 - which I will merge when this goes in.
items.title: Django: Get user model from settings

items.content_html:
This improves the pug form for the BookInstance update template so that the selected book has <option selected> rather than <option selected="selected">. Note that both are valid, and both work. It's just that the changed version is more familiar and easier to read.

note that setting the value to false is somewhat arbitrary - any value other than selected or the null string is taken as false.

Corresponding worked example update: mdn/express-locallibrary-tutorial#238

Fixes #29859
items.title: Express BookInstance update - better option select markup

items.content_html:
Description

This pull request fixes live example code for ARIA/Tab role sample code by checking whether DOMContentLoaded should be used as a trigger to initalize the code or not.

Motivation

The sample code for ARIA/Tab role isn't working. This is caused by listening to DOMContentLoaded event to run the initialization script when the document has already been loaded (can be checked with document.readyState === 'loading'.

To fix this behavior, we can check if we should listen to the corresponding event:

if (document.readyState !== 'loading') {
  init();
} else {
  window.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', init);
}

Additional details

The change has been tested to be working on the following environments:

  • Firefox 119.0 (Ubuntu)
  • Chrome 118.0.5993.117

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #29325
items.title: fix: use readyState to run scripts

items.content_html:
It can be observed in Firefox that the details in the OnBeforeSendHeaders callback have the frameAncestors field. This was previously not documented on MDN.

Description

Add frameAncestors to OnBeforeSendHeaders details field list.

Motivation

The field exists and might be useful for others to know about.

Additional details

I can't find any evidence of the field existing except that I exists in code that I need to maintain which was written by at-the-time Firefox contributors and that that code successfully returns the expected value just like in onBeforeRequest.
items.title: Add frameAncestors to OnBeforeSendHeaders.details
